title: How to Make Spicy Potato Salad

steps.headline: Cook the potatoes.Place the potatoes in the saucepan, cover with water and sprinkle with salt.
steps.description:
Bring the saucepan to the boil and simmer for 10 minutes until the potatoes are soft but not crumbling. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f5\/Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f5\/Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Drain the potatoes.When the potatoes are cooked, pour them into the sieve to drain.
steps.description:
Leave them for 20 minutes to cool down. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Make the salad.Into the bowl add the potatoes, whole grain mustard, Dijon mustard, mayonnaise, chopped parsley, chilli flakes and the gravlax.
Mix the ingredients well using a spoon.
Garnish and serve.Spoon the salad onto a plate, garnish with the caviar and serve.

text:
Cook the potatoes.Place the potatoes in the saucepan, cover with water and sprinkle with salt. Bring the saucepan to the boil and simmer for 10 minutes until the potatoes are soft but not crumbling. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Drain the potatoes.When the potatoes are cooked, pour them into the sieve to drain. Leave them for 20 minutes to cool down. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Spicy-Potato-Salad-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make the salad.Into the bowl add the potatoes, whole grain mustard, Dijon mustard, mayonnaise, chopped parsley, chilli flakes and the gravlax. Season with salt. Mix the ingredients well using a spoon. Garnish and serve.Spoon the salad onto a plate, garnish with the caviar and serve.
